page.title: 02PRIMARY FEATURES
page.content: The block is mainly farmland-mostly cereal crops but also pastural land for cows and sheep.The Roman{FOSSE WAY cuts through in a SW-NE line.There is evidence of pre-Roman occupation(round barrow or "tumulus").The NW sector contains the remains of the{SOMERSET and{DORSET LIGHT RAILWAY}("The old S.& D.").This was known locally as the "Sweet and Delightful" or "Slow and Dirty" depending on its punctuality. There are also the pitmounds of old coal-mines in many parts of the area.Some of the land is owned and administered by the{Duchy of Cornwall, providing income for the Prince of Wales.This is mostly farmland and well ordered buildings, although formerly it drew revenue from the coal-mines operating on its land.
